div1.p: Smith thanks Hench for the reprint and comments on Kean.

div1.head: Letter from Luther Ely Smith to Philip Showalter Hench, January 17, 1942
div1.opener:
LUTHER ELY SMITH
ATTORNEY AND COUNSELOR
SUITE 1554 TELEPHONE BUILDING
ST. LOUIS, MO.
Jan. 17, 1942.
LUTHER ELY SMITH
LUTHER ELY SMITH, JR.
VICTOR D. HARING
TELEPHONE
GARFIELD 0882
CABLE ADDRESS
“LESMITH”
No reply nec.
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
A million thanks to you for your very great
kindness and courtesy in sending that marvelously fine
painting or reproduction of the mural, and also of the
reprints of your speech. It was one of the most pa-
triotic and historical articles that I have ever had the
good fortune to read.

We were particularly interested and concerned
through our association with our good friend, General
Jefferson Randolph Kean. He is a very wonderful man,
and we are glad to have this very graphic evidence of
that finest type of heroism which he, in collaboration
with his associates, so cheerfully exhibited in the
great struggle in Cuba.
We are deeply indebted to him, and to you.
